FuncDef: The display trunkmembership ip-trunk command displays information about IP-Trunk interface and its members.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an IP-Trunk interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.

Examples: Number Of UP Ports in Trunk = 0
Interface Pos1/0/0, valid, operate up, weight=1
Interface Pos2/0/0, valid, operate offline, weight=1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After an IP-Trunk interface is successfully configured, you can run the display trunkmembership ip-trunk command to view the configuration of the IP-Trunk interface and its members.
To monitor the status of the IP-Trunk interface or locate a fault on the IP-Trunk interface, you can run the display trunkmembership ip-trunk command to obtain the status and statistics of the IP-Trunk interface.
Prerequisites
An IP-Trunk interface has been correctly configured.
